void EncodeBlock ( UHuffman *  encoder,
const short *  src,
const unsigned short *  quant,
unsigned char  chop 
)

perform the DCT and quantize.

store the DC term.

now encode the data as a run of bytes.

simply write out non-zero coefficients.

note that we reserve these two values for the encoding process. Therefor, if any values match it, we must clamp it to 0x82 (-126).

write out a run of zeros.

if we have a run length greater than one, then we should encode it. Otherwise, simply write the 0.

make sure we advance i.

write out the zero-length run if necessary.

end the block.

Definition at line 194 of file GrUTCompress.cpp.

void InsertBlockA ( unsigned char *  vDest,
unsigned int  bytesPerPel,
unsigned int  dstWidth,
unsigned int  dstX,
unsigned int  dstY,
short *  v 
)

note: The YCoCg decoding stage writes values as XMMWORDs. This means that the right way to do this is to read the values in as XMMWORDs, replace the alpha components, and then write them back out. If we don't do this, then we hit a store forwarding problem.

This function takes in one block of Co Cg values that each have a stride of 8 values. However, only 4 values from each row are actually written to because they are subsampled.
